mscPppRowStatusTable.name: mscPppRowStatusTable
mscPppRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscPpp components.

mscPppRowStatusEntry.name: mscPppRowStatusEntry
mscPppRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscPpp component.

mscPppRowStatus.name: mscPppRowStatus
mscPppRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscPpp components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscPppComponentName.name: mscPppComponentName
mscPppComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscPppStorageType.name: mscPppStorageType
mscPppStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscPpp tables.

mscPppIndex.name: mscPppIndex
mscPppIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscPpp tables.

mscPppCidDataTable.name: mscPppCidDataTable
mscPppCidDataTable.description: This group contains the attribute for a component's Customer Identifier (CID). Refer to the attribute description for a detailed explanation of CIDs.

mscPppCustomerIdentifier.name: mscPppCustomerIdentifier
mscPppCustomerIdentifier.description: This attribute holds the Customer Identifier (CID). Every component has a CID. If a component has a cid attribute, the component's CID is the provisioned value of that attribute; otherwise the component inherits the CID of its parent. The top- level component has a CID of 0. Every operator session also has a CID, which is the CID provisioned for the operator's user ID. An operator will see only the stream data for components having a matching CID. Also, the operator will be allowed to issue commands for only those components which have a matching CID. An operator CID of 0 is used to identify the Network Manager (referred to as 'NetMan' in DPN). This CID matches the CID of any component. Values 1 to 8191 inclusive (equivalent to 'basic CIDs' in DPN) may be assigned to specific customers.

mscPppIfEntryTable.name: mscPppIfEntryTable
mscPppIfEntryTable.description: This group contains the provisionable attributes for the ifEntry.

mscPppIfAdminStatus.name: mscPppIfAdminStatus
mscPppIfAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational. The down state indicates the interface is not operational. The testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

mscPppIfIndex.name: mscPppIfIndex
mscPppIfIndex.description: This is the index for the IfEntry. Its value is automatically initialized during the provisioning process.

mscPppMpTable.name: mscPppMpTable
mscPppMpTable.description: This group contains the base provisioning data for the Media Application component.

mscPppLinkToProtocolPort.name: mscPppLinkToProtocolPort
mscPppLinkToProtocolPort.description: This attribute contains a protocol port component name. The attribute associates the application with a protocol port.

mscPppStateTable.name: mscPppStateTable
mscPppStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

mscPppAdminState.name: mscPppAdminState
mscPppAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

mscPppOperationalState.name: mscPppOperationalState
mscPppOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

mscPppUsageState.name: mscPppUsageState
mscPppUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

mscPppOperStatusTable.name: mscPppOperStatusTable
mscPppOperStatusTable.description: This group includes the Operational Status attribute. This attribute defines the current operational state of this component.

mscPppSnmpOperStatus.name: mscPppSnmpOperStatus
mscPppSnmpOperStatus.description: The current state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and capable of forwarding packets. The down state indicates the interface is not operational, thus unable to forward packets. testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

mscPppLnkRowStatusTable.name: mscPppLnkRowStatusTable
mscPppLnkRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscPppLnk components.

mscPppLnkRowStatusEntry.name: mscPppLnkRowStatusEntry
mscPppLnkRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscPppLnk component.

mscPppLnkRowStatus.name: mscPppLnkRowStatus
mscPppLnkRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscPppLnk components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

mscPppLnkComponentName.name: mscPppLnkComponentName
mscPppLnkComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscPppLnkStorageType.name: mscPppLnkStorageType
mscPppLnkStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscPppLnk tables.

mscPppLnkIndex.name: mscPppLnkIndex
mscPppLnkIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscPppLnk tables.

mscPppLnkProvTable.name: mscPppLnkProvTable
mscPppLnkProvTable.description: This group contains the provisioned attributes for the Ppp Link component.

mscPppLnkConfigInitialMru.name: mscPppLnkConfigInitialMru
mscPppLnkConfigInitialMru.description: This is the initial Maximum Receive Unit (Mru) that the local Ppp entity will advertise to the remote entity. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

mscPppLnkConfigMagicNumber.name: mscPppLnkConfigMagicNumber
mscPppLnkConfigMagicNumber.description: If enabled then the local node will attempt to perform Magic Number negotiation with the remote node. If disabled then this negotiation is not performed. In any event, the local node will comply with any magic number negotiations attempted by the remote node, per the Ppp specification. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

mscPppLnkRestartTimer.name: mscPppLnkRestartTimer
mscPppLnkRestartTimer.description: This is the time, in milliseconds, that Ppp will wait for a response to a configure request or a terminate request before retrying.

mscPppLnkContinuityMonitor.name: mscPppLnkContinuityMonitor
mscPppLnkContinuityMonitor.description: This attribute turns on/off (enabled/disabled) the Link Continuity Monitor. If set to enabled, periodic keep alive echo packet will be sent over the Ppp link. If set to disabled, no keep alive packets will be sent. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/ unlock).

mscPppLnkNegativeAckTries.name: mscPppLnkNegativeAckTries
mscPppLnkNegativeAckTries.description: This attribute specifies the maximum negative acknowledgments sent to the remote Ppp entity during negotiation before defaulting it's configuration parameters.

mscPppLnkQualityThreshold.name: mscPppLnkQualityThreshold
mscPppLnkQualityThreshold.description: This attribute specifies the minimum allowed line quality before the line is considered too poor to continue operation. The value for this attribute is a percentage measure of the line quality given in integers (10 to 99). The higher the value, the more stringent the line requirements.

mscPppLnkQualityWindow.name: mscPppLnkQualityWindow
mscPppLnkQualityWindow.description: This attribute specifies the number of seconds used for sampling line quality. If line quality drops below the level set with the qualityThreshold attribute during this window, this instance of Ppp will be marked down until line quality recovers.

mscPppLnkTerminateRequestTries.name: mscPppLnkTerminateRequestTries
mscPppLnkTerminateRequestTries.description: This attribute specifies the maximum terminate requests to be sent, when closing the connection, and not answered before this instance of Ppp enters a closing state.

mscPppLnkConfigureRequestTries.name: mscPppLnkConfigureRequestTries
mscPppLnkConfigureRequestTries.description: This attribute specifies the number of configuration requests that will be sent out and not answered before this instance of Ppp enters a listening state. If both sides enter the listening state then the link will not come up. To eliminate this possibility, this attribute should be set to 1000000000. This will ensure that this end of the Ppp link will continue to try until the link is good.

mscPppLnkOperTable.name: mscPppLnkOperTable
mscPppLnkOperTable.description: This group contains the Ppp Link Operational attributes.

mscPppLnkOperState.name: mscPppLnkOperState
mscPppLnkOperState.description: This is the operational state of the Link Control Protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

mscPppLnkLineCondition.name: mscPppLnkLineCondition
mscPppLnkLineCondition.description: This attribute describes the condition of the physical line that Ppp is running over. ok: The condition of the line is good. looped: The line is looped back on itself, probably at the remote end. noClock: There is a hardware problem with the line. The cable may not be plugged in correctly. badLineCondition: The quality of the line is below the qualityThreshold.

mscPppLnkBadAddresses.name: mscPppLnkBadAddresses
mscPppLnkBadAddresses.description: This attribute counts the number of packets received with an incorrect Address Field. If this count is going up quickly, it could indicate that there is a line quality problem or that the remote end is transmitting a protocol other than Ppp. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLnkBadControls.name: mscPppLnkBadControls
mscPppLnkBadControls.description: This attribute counts the number of packets received on this link with an incorrect Control Field. If this count is going up quickly, it could indicate that there is a line quality problem or that the remote end is transmitting a protocol other than Ppp. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLnkPacketTooLongs.name: mscPppLnkPacketTooLongs
mscPppLnkPacketTooLongs.description: This attribute counts the number of packets received that have been discarded because their length exceeded the Maximum Receive Unit (Mru). This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLnkBadFcss.name: mscPppLnkBadFcss
mscPppLnkBadFcss.description: This attribute counts the number of packets received that have been discarded due to having an incorrect Frame Check Sequence (Fcs). This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLnkLocalMru.name: mscPppLnkLocalMru
mscPppLnkLocalMru.description: This is the current value of the Maximum Receive Unit (Mru) for the local Ppp Entity. This value is the Mru that the remote entity is using when sending packets to the local Ppp entity.

mscPppLnkRemoteMru.name: mscPppLnkRemoteMru
mscPppLnkRemoteMru.description: This is the current value of the Maximum Receive Unit (Mru) for the remote Ppp entity. This value is the Mru that the local entity is using when sending packets to the remote Ppp entity.

mscPppLnkTransmitFcsSize.name: mscPppLnkTransmitFcsSize
mscPppLnkTransmitFcsSize.description: This is the size of the Frame Check Sequence (Fcs) in bits that the local node will generate when sending packets to the remote node.

mscPppLnkReceiveFcsSize.name: mscPppLnkReceiveFcsSize
mscPppLnkReceiveFcsSize.description: This is the size of the Frame Check Sequence (Fcs) in bits that the remote node will generate when sending packets to the local node.

mscPppLqmRowStatusTable.name: mscPppLqmRowStatusTable
mscPppLqmRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscPppLqm components.

mscPppLqmRowStatusEntry.name: mscPppLqmRowStatusEntry
mscPppLqmRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscPppLqm component.

mscPppLqmRowStatus.name: mscPppLqmRowStatus
mscPppLqmRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscPppLqm components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

mscPppLqmComponentName.name: mscPppLqmComponentName
mscPppLqmComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscPppLqmStorageType.name: mscPppLqmStorageType
mscPppLqmStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscPppLqm tables.

mscPppLqmIndex.name: mscPppLqmIndex
mscPppLqmIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscPppLqm tables.

mscPppLqmProvTable.name: mscPppLqmProvTable
mscPppLqmProvTable.description: This group contains the provisioned attributes for the Ppp Link Quality Monitor component.

mscPppLqmConfigPeriod.name: mscPppLqmConfigPeriod
mscPppLqmConfigPeriod.description: This is the Lqm reporting period that the local Ppp entity will attempt to negotiate with the remote entity, in units of hundredths of a second. A value of '0' will allow the remote Ppp entity to determine the reporting period. A value greater than 180,000 (1/2 hour) will allow the period to be determined dynamically as a function of the transmit data rate. A value from 1-9 will be rounded up to 10 during negotiation. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

mscPppLqmConfigStatus.name: mscPppLqmConfigStatus
mscPppLqmConfigStatus.description: If this attribute is enabled, the local node will attempt to perform Lqm negotiation with the remote node. If it is disabled then this negotiation is not performed. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

mscPppLqmOperTable.name: mscPppLqmOperTable
mscPppLqmOperTable.description: This group contains the operational attributes for the Ppp Link Quality Monitor component.

mscPppLqmQuality.name: mscPppLqmQuality
mscPppLqmQuality.description: This is the current quality of the link as declared by the local Ppp entity's Link-Quality Management modules. A value of good indicates that LinkQualityMonitor configStatus is enabled and Link quality is above Link qualityThreshold. A value of bad indicates that LinkQualityMonitor configStatus is enabled and Link quality is not above Link qualityThreshold. A value of notDetermined indicates that LinkQualityMonitor configStatus is enabled and the quality of the link has not been calculated yet or LinkQualityMonitor configStatus is disabled.

mscPppLqmInGoodOctets.name: mscPppLqmInGoodOctets
mscPppLqmInGoodOctets.description: This attribute counts the number of good octets received. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLqmLocalPeriod.name: mscPppLqmLocalPeriod
mscPppLqmLocalPeriod.description: This is the Lqm reporting period, in hundredths of a second that is in effect for the local Ppp entity.

mscPppLqmRemotePeriod.name: mscPppLqmRemotePeriod
mscPppLqmRemotePeriod.description: This is the Lqm reporting period, in hundredths of a second, that is in effect for the remote Ppp entity.

mscPppLqmOutLqrs.name: mscPppLqmOutLqrs
mscPppLqmOutLqrs.description: This attribute counts the number of link quality reports sent out. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLqmInLqrs.name: mscPppLqmInLqrs
mscPppLqmInLqrs.description: This attribute counts the number of link quality reports received. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppNcpRowStatusTable.name: mscPppNcpRowStatusTable
mscPppNcpRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscPppNcp components.

mscPppNcpRowStatusEntry.name: mscPppNcpRowStatusEntry
mscPppNcpRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscPppNcp component.

mscPppNcpRowStatus.name: mscPppNcpRowStatus
mscPppNcpRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscPppNcp components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

mscPppNcpComponentName.name: mscPppNcpComponentName
mscPppNcpComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscPppNcpStorageType.name: mscPppNcpStorageType
mscPppNcpStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscPppNcp tables.

mscPppNcpIndex.name: mscPppNcpIndex
mscPppNcpIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscPppNcp tables.

mscPppNcpBprovTable.name: mscPppNcpBprovTable
mscPppNcpBprovTable.description: This group contains the provisioned attributes for the Bridge Network Control Protocol.

mscPppNcpBConfigTinygram.name: mscPppNcpBConfigTinygram
mscPppNcpBConfigTinygram.description: If this attribute is set to disabled then the local Bridge Network Control Protocol (Bncp) entity will not initiate the tinygram compression option negotiation. If it is enabled then the local Bncp entity will initiate negotiation of this option. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

mscPppNcpBConfigLanId.name: mscPppNcpBConfigLanId
mscPppNcpBConfigLanId.description: If this attribute is set to disabled then the local Bncp entity will not initiate the lan identification option negotiation. If it is enabled then the local Bncp entity will initiate negotiation of the option. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

mscPppNcpIpOperTable.name: mscPppNcpIpOperTable
mscPppNcpIpOperTable.description: This group contains the Ip Network Control Protocol operational attributes.

mscPppNcpIpOperState.name: mscPppNcpIpOperState
mscPppNcpIpOperState.description: This is the operational state of the Ip network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

mscPppNcpBoperTable.name: mscPppNcpBoperTable
mscPppNcpBoperTable.description: This group contains the Bridge Network Control Protocol operational attributes.

mscPppNcpBOperState.name: mscPppNcpBOperState
mscPppNcpBOperState.description: This is the operational status of the bridge network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

mscPppNcpBLocalToRemoteTinygramComp.name: mscPppNcpBLocalToRemoteTinygramComp
mscPppNcpBLocalToRemoteTinygramComp.description: This attribute indicates whether the local node will perform tinygram compression when sending packets to the remote entity. If it is disabled then the local entity will not perform tinygram compression. If it is enabled then the local entity will perform tinygram compression.

mscPppNcpBRemoteToLocalTinygramComp.name: mscPppNcpBRemoteToLocalTinygramComp
mscPppNcpBRemoteToLocalTinygramComp.description: If this attribute is disabled then the remote entity is not expected to perform tinygram compression. If it is enabled then the remote entity is expected to perform tinygram compression.

mscPppNcpBLocalToRemoteLanId.name: mscPppNcpBLocalToRemoteLanId
mscPppNcpBLocalToRemoteLanId.description: This attribute indicates whether the local node will include the lan identification field in transmitted packets or not. If it is disabled then the local node will not transmit this field, enabled means that the field will be transmitted.

mscPppNcpBRemoteToLocalLanId.name: mscPppNcpBRemoteToLocalLanId
mscPppNcpBRemoteToLocalLanId.description: This attribute indicates whether the remote node has indicated that it will include the lan identification field in transmitted packets or not. If it is disabled then the field will not be transmitted, if enabled then the field will be transmitted.

mscPppNcpOperTable.name: mscPppNcpOperTable
mscPppNcpOperTable.description: This group contains the operational attributes for any Network Control Protocols other than Ip and Bridge.

mscPppNcpAppletalkOperState.name: mscPppNcpAppletalkOperState
mscPppNcpAppletalkOperState.description: This is the operational state of the AppleTalk network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

mscPppNcpIpxOperState.name: mscPppNcpIpxOperState
mscPppNcpIpxOperState.description: This is the operational state of the Ipx network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

mscPppNcpXnsOperState.name: mscPppNcpXnsOperState
mscPppNcpXnsOperState.description: This is the operational state of the Xns network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

mscPppNcpDecnetOperState.name: mscPppNcpDecnetOperState
mscPppNcpDecnetOperState.description: This is the operational state of the DecNet network protocol. For more information as to the definition of each state see RFC1331 section 5.3.

mscPppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusTable.name: mscPppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusTable
mscPppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscPppNcpBmcEntry components.

mscPppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusEntry.name: mscPppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusEntry
mscPppNcpBmcEntryRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscPppNcpBmcEntry component.

mscPppNcpBmcEntryRowStatus.name: mscPppNcpBmcEntryRowStatus
mscPppNcpBmcEntryRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscPppNcpBmcEntry components. These components can be added.

mscPppNcpBmcEntryComponentName.name: mscPppNcpBmcEntryComponentName
mscPppNcpBmcEntryComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscPppNcpBmcEntryStorageType.name: mscPppNcpBmcEntryStorageType
mscPppNcpBmcEntryStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscPppNcpBmcEntry tables.

mscPppNcpBmcEntryMacTypeIndex.name: mscPppNcpBmcEntryMacTypeIndex
mscPppNcpBmcEntryMacTypeIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscPppNcpBmcEntry tables.

mscPppNcpBmcEntryProvTable.name: mscPppNcpBmcEntryProvTable
mscPppNcpBmcEntryProvTable.description: This group contains the attributes for one entry in the BridgeMediaConfigEntry table.

mscPppNcpBmcEntryLocalStatus.name: mscPppNcpBmcEntryLocalStatus
mscPppNcpBmcEntryLocalStatus.description: This attribute indicates whether the local Ppp bridging entity should accept packets of the protocol type identified by the instance value of this component. Setting this attribute to accept allows packets of this protocol type to be accepted. A change to this attribute will not take effect until Ppp is restarted (lock/unlock).

mscPppNcpBmEntryRowStatusTable.name: mscPppNcpBmEntryRowStatusTable
mscPppNcpBmEntryRowStatusTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscPppNcpBmEntry components.

mscPppNcpBmEntryRowStatusEntry.name: mscPppNcpBmEntryRowStatusEntry
mscPppNcpBmEntryRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscPppNcpBmEntry component.

mscPppNcpBmEntryRowStatus.name: mscPppNcpBmEntryRowStatus
mscPppNcpBmEntryRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscPppNcpBmEntry components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

mscPppNcpBmEntryComponentName.name: mscPppNcpBmEntryComponentName
mscPppNcpBmEntryComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscPppNcpBmEntryStorageType.name: mscPppNcpBmEntryStorageType
mscPppNcpBmEntryStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscPppNcpBmEntry tables.

mscPppNcpBmEntryMacTypeIndex.name: mscPppNcpBmEntryMacTypeIndex
mscPppNcpBmEntryMacTypeIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscPppNcpBmEntry tables.

mscPppNcpBmEntryOperTable.name: mscPppNcpBmEntryOperTable
mscPppNcpBmEntryOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This group contains the attributes for one entry in the BridgeMediaEntry table.

mscPppNcpBmEntryLocalStatus.name: mscPppNcpBmEntryLocalStatus
mscPppNcpBmEntryLocalStatus.description: This attribute indicates whether the local Ppp bridging entity will accept packets of the protocol type identified by the instance value of this component. A value of accept indicates that packets of this protocol type will be accepted. A value of dontAccept indicates that packets of this type will not be accepted.

mscPppNcpBmEntryRemoteStatus.name: mscPppNcpBmEntryRemoteStatus
mscPppNcpBmEntryRemoteStatus.description: This attribute indicates whether the remote Ppp bridging entity will accept packets of the protocol type identified by the instance value of this component. A value of accept indicates that packets of this protocol type will be accepted. A value of dontAccept indicates that packets of this type will not be accepted.

mscPppFramerRowStatusTable.name: mscPppFramerRowStatusTable
mscPppFramerRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscPppFramer components.

mscPppFramerRowStatusEntry.name: mscPppFramerRowStatusEntry
mscPppFramerRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscPppFramer component.

mscPppFramerRowStatus.name: mscPppFramerRowStatus
mscPppFramerRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscPppFramer components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

mscPppFramerComponentName.name: mscPppFramerComponentName
mscPppFramerComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscPppFramerStorageType.name: mscPppFramerStorageType
mscPppFramerStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscPppFramer tables.

mscPppFramerIndex.name: mscPppFramerIndex
mscPppFramerIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscPppFramer tables.

mscPppFramerProvTable.name: mscPppFramerProvTable
mscPppFramerProvTable.description: This group contains the base provisioning data for the Framer component. Application or hardware interface specific provisioning data is contained in other provisionable Framer groups.

mscPppFramerInterfaceName.name: mscPppFramerInterfaceName
mscPppFramerInterfaceName.description: This attribute contains a hardware component name. The attribute associates the application with a specific link. This defines the logical processor on which Framer's parent component (as well as Framer itself) will run.

mscPppFramerStateTable.name: mscPppFramerStateTable
mscPppFramerStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

mscPppFramerAdminState.name: mscPppFramerAdminState
mscPppFramerAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

mscPppFramerOperationalState.name: mscPppFramerOperationalState
mscPppFramerOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

mscPppFramerUsageState.name: mscPppFramerUsageState
mscPppFramerUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

mscPppFramerStatsTable.name: mscPppFramerStatsTable
mscPppFramerStatsTable.description: This group contains the operational statistics data for a Framer component.

mscPppFramerFrmToIf.name: mscPppFramerFrmToIf
mscPppFramerFrmToIf.description: This attribute counts the number of frames transmitted to the link interface by Framer. Note: This does not include the number of frames transmitted directly to the hardware queue, thus bypassing the Framer component.

mscPppFramerFrmFromIf.name: mscPppFramerFrmFromIf
mscPppFramerFrmFromIf.description: This attribute counts the number of frames received from the link interface by Framer.

mscPppFramerAborts.name: mscPppFramerAborts
mscPppFramerAborts.description: This attribute counts the total number of aborts received.

mscPppFramerCrcErrors.name: mscPppFramerCrcErrors
mscPppFramerCrcErrors.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames with CRC errors.

mscPppFramerLrcErrors.name: mscPppFramerLrcErrors
mscPppFramerLrcErrors.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames with LRC errors.

mscPppFramerNonOctetErrors.name: mscPppFramerNonOctetErrors
mscPppFramerNonOctetErrors.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames that were non octet aligned.

mscPppFramerOverruns.name: mscPppFramerOverruns
mscPppFramerOverruns.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames received from the link for which overruns occurred.

mscPppFramerUnderruns.name: mscPppFramerUnderruns
mscPppFramerUnderruns.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames transmitted to the link for which underruns occurred.

mscPppFramerLargeFrmErrors.name: mscPppFramerLargeFrmErrors
mscPppFramerLargeFrmErrors.description: This attribute counts the total number of frames received which were too large. The frame execeeded the maximumFrameLengthLimit provisioned attribute or it contained more than the 255 block hardware limit.

mscPppFramerUtilTable.name: mscPppFramerUtilTable
mscPppFramerUtilTable.description: This group contains the link utilizaiton operational data for a Framer component.

mscPppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilToIf.name: mscPppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilToIf
mscPppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilToIf.description: This attribute is the utilization of the normal priority data sent to the link as a percentage of the available bandwidth on the link. The utilization is the average for the last minute.

mscPppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilFromIf.name: mscPppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilFromIf
mscPppFramerNormPrioLinkUtilFromIf.description: This attribute is the utilization of the normal priority data received from the link as a percentage of the available bandwidth on the link. The utilization is the average for the last minute.

mscPppLeqRowStatusTable.name: mscPppLeqRowStatusTable
mscPppLeqRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of mscPppLeq components.

mscPppLeqRowStatusEntry.name: mscPppLeqRowStatusEntry
mscPppLeqRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single mscPppLeq component.

mscPppLeqRowStatus.name: mscPppLeqRowStatus
mscPppLeqRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of mscPppLeq components. These components can be added and deleted.

mscPppLeqComponentName.name: mscPppLeqComponentName
mscPppLeqComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

mscPppLeqStorageType.name: mscPppLeqStorageType
mscPppLeqStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the mscPppLeq tables.

mscPppLeqIndex.name: mscPppLeqIndex
mscPppLeqIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the mscPppLeq tables.

mscPppLeqProvTable.name: mscPppLeqProvTable
mscPppLeqProvTable.description: This group contains the provisioned attributes for the LinkEmissionQueue component.

mscPppLeqMaxPackets.name: mscPppLeqMaxPackets
mscPppLeqMaxPackets.description: This attribute specifies the maximum number of packets allowed in the Leq before being discarded. If this attribute is set to zero then the maximum number of packets is calculated from the transmit data rate. This calculated value is placed in queuePktThreshold.

mscPppLeqMaxMsecData.name: mscPppLeqMaxMsecData
mscPppLeqMaxMsecData.description: This attribute specifies the maximum number of 'Milliseconds worth of data' allowed in the Leq before packets are discarded. The queueByteThreshold will be calculated from this attribute, based on the transmit data rate.

mscPppLeqMaxPercentMulticast.name: mscPppLeqMaxPercentMulticast
mscPppLeqMaxPercentMulticast.description: This attribute specifies the maximum percentage of multicast packets allowed in the Leq, based on queuePktThreshold, before being discarded. The calculated value will be placed in queueMulticastThreshold.

mscPppLeqTimeToLive.name: mscPppLeqTimeToLive
mscPppLeqTimeToLive.description: This attribute specifies the 'Milliseconds Time To Live' of packets in the Leq. If the timeToLive of a packet expires, it will be discarded.

mscPppLeqStatsTable.name: mscPppLeqStatsTable
mscPppLeqStatsTable.description: This group contains Link Emission Queue general statistics.

mscPppLeqTimedOutPkt.name: mscPppLeqTimedOutPkt
mscPppLeqTimedOutPkt.description: This attribute counts the number of packets that have been discarded due to exceeding the timeToLive. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqHardwareForcedPkt.name: mscPppLeqHardwareForcedPkt
mscPppLeqHardwareForcedPkt.description: This attribute counts the number of hardware forced packets on this instance of Ppp. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqForcedPktDiscards.name: mscPppLeqForcedPktDiscards
mscPppLeqForcedPktDiscards.description: This attribute counts the total number of hardware forced packets that had to be discarded due to link failure. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqQueuePurgeDiscards.name: mscPppLeqQueuePurgeDiscards
mscPppLeqQueuePurgeDiscards.description: This attribute counts the total number of packets discarded by a queue purge (i.e. a discarding of all packets on the queue). This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqTStatsTable.name: mscPppLeqTStatsTable
mscPppLeqTStatsTable.description: This group contains Link Emission Queue total statistics.

mscPppLeqTotalPktHandled.name: mscPppLeqTotalPktHandled
mscPppLeqTotalPktHandled.description: This attribute counts the total number of packets handled by the Leq. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqTotalPktForwarded.name: mscPppLeqTotalPktForwarded
mscPppLeqTotalPktForwarded.description: This attribute counts the total number of packets forwarded by the Leq. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqTotalPktQueued.name: mscPppLeqTotalPktQueued
mscPppLeqTotalPktQueued.description: This attribute counts the total number of packets that required queuing by the Leq due to transmit congestion. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqTotalMulticastPkt.name: mscPppLeqTotalMulticastPkt
mscPppLeqTotalMulticastPkt.description: This attribute counts the total number of multicast packets handled by this instance of Ppp. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqTotalPktDiscards.name: mscPppLeqTotalPktDiscards
mscPppLeqTotalPktDiscards.description: This attribute counts the total number of packets that were discarded for this instance of Ppp. This is the sum of timedOutPkt, forcedPktDiscards, queuePurgeDiscards, pktThresholdExceeded, byteThresholdExceeded, mulThresholdExceeded, and memThresholdExceeded. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqCStatsTable.name: mscPppLeqCStatsTable
mscPppLeqCStatsTable.description: This group contains Link Emission Queue current statistics.

mscPppLeqCurrentPktQueued.name: mscPppLeqCurrentPktQueued
mscPppLeqCurrentPktQueued.description: This attribute counts the current number of packets queued.

mscPppLeqCurrentBytesQueued.name: mscPppLeqCurrentBytesQueued
mscPppLeqCurrentBytesQueued.description: This attribute counts the current number of bytes queued.

mscPppLeqCurrentMulticastQueued.name: mscPppLeqCurrentMulticastQueued
mscPppLeqCurrentMulticastQueued.description: This attribute counts the current number of multicast packets in the queue.

mscPppLeqThrStatsTable.name: mscPppLeqThrStatsTable
mscPppLeqThrStatsTable.description: This group contains Link Emission Queue threshold statistics.

mscPppLeqQueuePktThreshold.name: mscPppLeqQueuePktThreshold
mscPppLeqQueuePktThreshold.description: This attribute is the maximum number of packets that can be contained in the queue before being discarded. If maxPackets was set to 0 then this attribute will contain the value that has been calculated based on the transmit data rate. If maxPackets was set to one or more than this attribute will contain that number.

mscPppLeqPktThresholdExceeded.name: mscPppLeqPktThresholdExceeded
mscPppLeqPktThresholdExceeded.description: This attribute counts the number of packets discarded due to the queuePktThreshold being exceeded. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqQueueByteThreshold.name: mscPppLeqQueueByteThreshold
mscPppLeqQueueByteThreshold.description: This attribute is the maximum number of bytes allowed in the queue based on maxMsecData and the transmit data rate.

mscPppLeqByteThresholdExceeded.name: mscPppLeqByteThresholdExceeded
mscPppLeqByteThresholdExceeded.description: This attribute counts the number of packets discarded due to the queueByteThreshold being exceeded. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqQueueMulticastThreshold.name: mscPppLeqQueueMulticastThreshold
mscPppLeqQueueMulticastThreshold.description: This attribute is the number of multicast packets allowed in the queue based on maxPercentMulticast and maxPackets.

mscPppLeqMulThresholdExceeded.name: mscPppLeqMulThresholdExceeded
mscPppLeqMulThresholdExceeded.description: This attribute counts the number of packets discarded due to the queueMulticastThreshold being exceeded. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

mscPppLeqMemThresholdExceeded.name: mscPppLeqMemThresholdExceeded
mscPppLeqMemThresholdExceeded.description: This attribute counts the number of packets discarded due to exceeding the memory usage threshold for Leq. The memory usage threshold is determined by the Leq software, guaranteeing that the Leq does not consume all of the memory. This counter will wrap around to 0 when it exceeds its maximum count.

comments: Produced by pysmi-0.3.4 at Tue Apr 20 15:13:38 2021
